2/Second Half
Offensively Madrid improved exploiting weaknesses in our defense: The lack of a DM gave Belli too much freedom and they also stopped playing aimless long balls taking needed risks in buildup which worked for them especially with our press being softer due to fatigue

With Madrid’s midfielders overcommitted to helping Fran García against Yamal (literally 3 of their 4 midfielders focusing on him!), Pedri was left unmarked at the edge of the box. He exploited it with a perfect finish to score the well-deserved opening goal.

After our goal, in the last 15 minutes of the half, Madrid had no choice but to press again. This made us lose some control but also opened huge spaces behind their defense — spaces we sadly failed to exploit, mainly because of Raphinha’s unusually poor and rushed decision-making

Madrid also started beating our press by having Belli drop deep to combine with Vázquez or create individually. However, it didn’t lead to danger — even when they beat the press, they couldn't escape our offside trap, scoring an offside goal and winning a pen after Vini's offside

More importantly, our counter-pressing (the famous 5-second rule) made a massive difference compared to Madrid. as you can see here, When we lost the ball, everyone immediately pressed with full intensity to win it back while when Real Madrid loose the ball...

Our pressing structure prevented Madrid from building from the back, forcing long balls. Even after losing aerials, our full-backs and midfielders quickly reset. You can see it in the first image, and seconds later in the second, both full-backs are already in position.

In short, Madrid managed to partly neutralize our wide threat. But they failed to stop us from attacking centrally or dictating the rhythm, on top of that our pressing made the half even more one-sided as they spent the whole half defending hardly even leaving the centre line.

Overall, Madrid’s focus on the right worked: they neutralized Yamal without getting punished due to our lack of threat from the left. But it came at a price — committing Ceballos to help Fran García cost them the natural midfield advantage as they lost one of their 4 midfielders.

From there, defensively, Madrid focused heavily on closing down our right side. Vini Jr. pressed Cubarsí intensely to prevent any buildup from the right, while Ceballos stayed close to Fran García to constantly create 1v2 situations against Lamine Yamal.
